publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1151# Cathy Peattie: Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners-That the Parliament supports the call for posthumous pardons to be granted to suffrage supporters who went to prison during the votes for women campaign between 1909 and 1914.

S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*, Pauline McNeill*, Mark Ballard*, Susan Deacon*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Rob Gibson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Patrick Harvie*

S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Kate Maclean*, Rosie Kane*, Brian Adam*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Elaine Smith*, Robin Harper*, Jackie Baillie*, Eleanor Scott*, Marlyn Glen*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, John Swinburne*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Campbell Martin*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*, Bill Butler*, Chris Ballance*, Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Dr Jean Turner*, Johann Lamont*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*, Michael Matheson*, Karen Whitefield*, Cathie Craigie*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Sarah Boyack*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Linda Fabiani*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Shiona Baird*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-1151# Posthumous Pardon for Suffragette Prisoners (lodged on 2 April 2004) Trish Godman*
